citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
***USDA Officials were unable to review records during inspection. Licensee stated the contingency plan was on his
computer but the computer is down. There were no records of animals on hand, Program of Veterinary Care or animal
dispositions available for review. Records shall be developed, maintained on hand and made available for review by
USDA Officials during inspection. Correct by March 25, 2023

***There is no written contingency plan for emergencies. The licensee must must develop, document, and follow an
appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the
event of an emergency or disaster. The plan shall be made available for review during inspection. Correct by March 25,
2023.

***The large tree that fell on the fence along the right side of the back reindeer enclosure, previously cited, remains on the
fence. The fence wire is compressed and bowed reducing the structural strength of the fence and the reindeer have
access to the broken tree and tree limbs which have created an injury hazard. The tree shall be removed from the fence
and the fence repaired to protect the reindeer from injury and maintain them securely within their enclosure.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Jeffrey Shepherd, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALISTEnd Section

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
***USDA Officials were unable to review records during inspection.  Licensee stated the contingency plan was on his 
computer but the computer is down.  There were no records of animals on hand, Program of Veterinary Care or animal 
dispositions available for review.  Records shall be developed, maintained on hand and made available for review by 
USDA Officials during inspection.  Correct by March 25, 2023 
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
***There is no written contingency plan for emergencies.  The licensee must  must develop, document, and follow an 
appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the 
event of an emergency or disaster.  The plan shall be made available for review during inspection.  Correct by March 25, 
2023. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
***The large tree that fell on the fence along the right side of the back reindeer enclosure, previously cited, remains on the 
fence.  The fence wire is compressed and bowed reducing the structural strength of the fence and the reindeer have

access to the  broken tree and tree limbs which have created an injury hazard.  The tree shall be removed from the fence 
and the fence repaired to protect the reindeer from injury and maintain them securely within their enclosure. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Jeffrey Shepherd, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALISTEnd Section
